comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Airborne monochrome picture of two A-6A Intruders from VA-196 'Main Battery' tail code NE of Carrier Air Wing Two (CVW-2). Nearest is Bu No 155599 Modex 512 and furthest is Bu No 155604 Modex 504 Black ace symbol of VA-196 aft of cockpit. Both in gull gray and white scheme with radome overspray 'USS RANGER' over national insignia. It is extremely fortunate there is an internet record for the two aircraft: www.gonavy.jp/CVW-NEf.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW2-NE1969.html VA-196 'Main Battery' is recorded as having both aircraft as pictured A-6A 155599 as Modex 511 A-6A 155604 as Modex 504 The squadron only sailed once aboard CVA-61 USS RANGER with CVW-2. This was between October 14, 1969 & June 1, 1970 for a Vietnam War deployment over Laos and North Vietnam …………………………………………………………………………………………….. Very fortunately the operational career of A-6A Intruder 155599 is fairly well documented on website 'GO!NAVY': www.gonavy.jp/ A-6A 155599 was used in at least two wartime deployments over South East Asia & Vietnam. 1968-1969 record for A-6A 155599: www.gonavy.jp/CVW2-NE1968.html CVW-2 (NE) CVA-61 USS RANGER October 26, 1968 - May 17, 1969 (Vietnam War) A-6A 155599 VA-165 'Boomers' Modex 512 1971-1972 record including A-6A 155599: www.gonavy.jp/CVW14-NK1971.html CVW-14 (NK) CVAN-65 USS ENTERPRISE June 11, 1971 – February 12, 1972 (Vietnam War) A-6A 155599 VA-196 'Main Battery' Modex 513 Sometime during the mid 1970's A-6A Bu No 155599 was updated to A-6E. It was also equipped with the 'TRAM' system for pinpoint targeting and laser bombing. 1979-1980 record including A-6E 155599: www.gonavy.jp/CVW15-NL1979.html CVW-15 (NL) CV-63 USS KITTY HAWK May 30, 1979 – February 25, 1980 (WestPac) A-6E 155599 VA-52 'Knightriders' Modex 507 1981 record of A-6E 155599: www.gonavy.jp/CVW15-NL1981.html CVW-15 (NL) CV-63 USS KITTY HAWK April 1 – November 23, 1981 (Western Pacfic) A-6E 155599 VA-52 'Knightriders' Modex 507 Four 1983 pictures of A-6E 155599 'TRAM' Intruder: www.airliners.net/photo/USA---Navy/Grumman-A-6E-Intruder/... www.airliners.net/photo/USA---Navy/Grumman-A-6E-Intruder/... www.airliners.net/photo/USA---Navy/Grumman-A-6E-Intruder/... www.airliners.net/photo/USA---Navy/Grumman-A-6E-Intruder/... A-6E 'TRAM' 155599 VA-65 "Tigers" Modex 501 tail code AG of CVW-7. CVN-69 USS Dwight D Eisenhower. Attending 35 years of 323 Sqn Netherlands Air Force, Leeuwarden Air Base. October 20/21, 1983 1984-1985 record for A-6E 155599: www.gonavy.jp/CVW7-AG1984-2.html CVW-7 (AG) CVN-69 USS DWIGHT D. EISENHOWER October 10, 1984 - May 8, 1985 (Mediterranean Sea) A-6E 155599 VA-65 Modex 512. Pictures available commercially of A-6E 155599 from this website mar.co.uk/ In 'Search' box on top right Input N12937 for 1990 picture of A-6E 155599 with VA-176 'Thunderbolts' as Modex 506, code AE of CVW-3. Input N13120 for 1985 picture of A-6E 155599 with VA-65 'Tigers' as Modex 500, code AG of CVW-7. CV-69 USS Dwight D Eisenhower. Input N15154 for 1987 picture of A-6E 155599 with VA-65 'Tigers' as Modex 504, code AG of CVW-7.CV-69 USS Dwight D Eisenhower. Input N18508 Input N15154 for 1990D picture of A-6E 155599 with VA-34 ' Blue Blasters as Modex 504, code AG of CVW-7.CV-69 USS Dwight D Eisenhower. 1990 record including A-6E 155599: www.gonavy.jp/CVW7-AG1990-2.html CVW-7 (AG) CVN-69 USS DWIGHT D.EISENHOWER March 8, 1990 – Sept 12, 1990 (Mediterranean Sea & Persian Gulf) A-6E 155599 VA-34 "Blue Blasters" Modex 504 1990 picture of A-6E 155599 'TRAM' Intruder: www.airliners.net/photo/USA---Navy/Grumman-A-6E-Intruder/... A-6E 155599 VA-34 "Blue Blasters" Modex 504 tail code AG of CVW-7. Deck of CVN-69 USS Dwight D Eisenhower. Palma de Mallorca Bay, Balearic Isles, Mediterranean Sea. June 16, 1990 1991 record including A-6E 155599: www.gonavy.jp/CVW7-AG1991.html CVW-7 (AG) CVN-69 USS DWIGHT D.EISENHOWER September 26, 1991 – April 2, 1992 (Mediterranean Sea) A-6E 155599 VA-34 'Blue Blasters' Modex 504 Confusing entries for A-6E 155599 as possibly crashing on 7 November 1990. www.ejection-history.org.uk/aircraft_by_type/a6_prowler.htm This website records info chronologically so use slider to scroll down to two dates for Nov. 7 1990. Yet A-6E 155599 is recorded as existing during 1991. It is not yet exactly known from internet sources what was the eventual fate of A-6A/E 155599. There is no known record of it being retired to AMARC storage in Arizona. The aircraft may have been stored at a Naval Air Depot then scrapped. …………………………………………………………………………………………….. A-6A 155604 www.gonavy.jp/CVW2-NE1968.html CVW-2 (NE) CVA-61 USS RANGER Oct.26, 1968 - May 17, 1969 (Vietnam War) A-6A 155604 VA-165 'Boomers' Modex 504 Three webpages recording Intruder Bu No 155604 starting out as an A-6A, becoming an A-6E, then metamorphosing into a KA-6D: www.joebaugher.com/usattack/newa6_1.html www.joebaugher.com/usattack/newa6_4.html www.joebaugher.com/usattack/newa6_7.html All info courtesy of Professor Joe Baugher, Chicago, Illinois. During the 1970's Bu No 155604 was modernized and uprated to A-6E. A 1977 picture of A-6E 155604 with US Marine Corps unit VMA(AW)-224 'Bengals' Squadron tail code WK, Modex 07. visipix.dynalias.com/newsgroups/newsgroups/gr_result.php?... Input 155604 over 1556 in box , click on 'Go' for picture, click on aircraft pic' to view. Note incorrect caption; "A-6E 155604 VMA(AW)-533 4-22-77" [date is interpreted as April 22 1977] 1978-1979 record for A-6E 155604 with VMA(AW)-224: www.gonavy.jp/usmc/05/usmc0502.html Unit Deployment Program Marine Aircraft Group Twelve forward based at MACAS Iwakuni, Japan had VMA(AW)-224 'Bengals' (code WK) with A-6E 155604 Modex 07 (later Modex 357) from May 1978 to May 1979. From May 5, 1980 A-6E 155604 was stored at the then MASDC in Arizona as AN5A0039. It was later returned to service. Sometime between 1980 & 1984 Bu No 155604 was placed into a further conversion program. To strip out all attack capability and be made into a permanent air refueling tanker with modified fuel control & hose and drogue unit in rear fuselage, thus becoming a KA-6D. 1984 record for KA-6D 155604: www.gonavy.jp/CVW7-AG1984-1.html CVW-7 (AG) CVN-69 USS DWIGHT D. EISENHOWER May 8 – June 20, 1984 (Caribbean & North Atlantic Ocean) KA-6D 155604 VA-65 'Tigers' Modex 513. June 1984 British spotters report including KA-6D 155604: homepage.ntlworld.com/nigel.sadler1/page_article_CVN-69%2... CVN-69 USS Dwight D Eisenhower anchored in Stokes Bay on 1 June arriving for the D-Day 40th Anniversary. Sailed for Brest on 6 June. Had crossed Atlantic Ocean via the Azores and Portugal following exercises off Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. 1st to 6th June 1991, anchored in Stokes Bay off Portsmouth harbor, England, UK. KA-6D 155604 VA-65 'Tigers' Modex 513. 1984-1985 record including KA-6E 155604: www.gonavy.jp/CVW7-AG1984-2.html CVW-7 (AG) CVN-69 USS DWIGHT D. EISENHOWER October 10, 1984 - May 8, 1985 (Mediterranean Sea) KA-6D 155604 VA-65 'Tigers' Modex 516. 1991 British spotters report including KA-6E 155604: homepage.ntlworld.com/nigel.sadler1/page_article_CV-66%20... KA-6D 155604 VA-85 'Black Falcons' Modex 520. Code AB of CVW-1 CV-66 USS America. Anchored off Portsmouth harbor, England, UK. 24 to 28 September 1991. It's not yet known from internet sources what was the eventual fate of A-6A/E/KA-6D Intruder 155604. There's no known record of it being retired to AMARC storage in Arizona. The aircraft may have been stored at a Naval Air Depot then disposed of for salvage.. …………………………………………………………………………………………….. (Info in GO!NAVY' website is gathered purely on a voluntary basis and may be fragmentary. It is extremely fortunate when there are records of actual aircraft and their serial numbers available. For which recognition and appreciation of Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan and naval air historian for all ‘GO!NAVY’ references is well deserved)
